meanings.definition: Capable of being issued or put forth.
meanings.sent1: The report contained many issuable recommendations for improvement.
meanings.sent2: The new stamps were issuable for purchase starting today.
meanings.sent3: The issuable ideas in the meeting made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was an issuable fountain of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The issuable solutions presented were clear and practical.

meanings.definition: Able to be brought before a court for determination.
meanings.sent1: The legal document was deemed issuable for the upcoming trial.
meanings.sent2: The evidence was issuable in the ongoing investigation.
meanings.sent3: The issuable case brought unexpected twists in court.
meanings.sent4: His arguments were an issuable force to be reckoned with.
meanings.sent5: The issuable matter required careful consideration by the judge.

meanings.sent1: The revised policy was finally issuable to all employees.
meanings.sent2: The certificates were issuable upon completion of the course.
meanings.sent3: The issuable documents were neatly organized in the folder.
meanings.sent4: Her qualifications were an issuable match for the job.
meanings.sent5: The issuable permits were ready for distribution to the public.
